page.title: 04Post Office, Otford.
page.content: On Friday three of us went to the Post Office and spoke to the Sub- Postmaster. The Post Office commenced in Otford in 1934 when it was where Nicola's is now. Then it moved to where the Gunshop is, then to the Chemist's and finally to where it is now in Sevenoaks Road. There are approximately 350 customers a day served by five employees. Thursday is the busiest day and the beginning and end of the month are also very busy. The hours worked are usually 9.0 am to 1.0 pm and 2.0 pm to 5.30 pm, except for Wednesday when they are open in the mornings only and similarly on Saturdays. They get paid monthly (They are salaried) and the amount they get depends on how many points they score. The more points, the more money.
